developerResponse: {'id': 29511940, 'body': 'Our apologies for any problems you are having. Can you please send us an email to support@myfitnesspal.com for further help? Thanks!', 'modified': '2022-05-02T13:33:02Z'}
review:
I set my macronutrient goals which is great to follow. Hitting my targets within 1-2g variance daily. Only I‚Äôve just realised when I actually click on my carbs for the day I‚Äôm not really 1-2g of variance the soo glitches and adjusts my goals so when I think I‚Äôm 1g out from my 270 carb target because the app says I am. When clicking into carbs I‚Äôm actually 8g over my carb target for the day because the app has changed it for the day. Completely frustrating considering it has threw off all my targets for the week.
UPDATE: I have managed to switch off the setting that automatically adjusts the goals based off your  exercise and daily steps. Problem solved! For anyone else with the same issue go into more-> goals-> scroll to the bottom and click exercise calories -> turn off adjust my calorie goal. 

Changing review to 5 stars
title: Issue with automatically adjusting daily macro goals.

developerResponse: {'id': 33572596, 'body': "Our apologies for any issues you've come across. Please see https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360032622691-Some-food-information-in-the-database-is-inaccurate.-Can-I-edit-it for more information. Can you please send us an email to https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new for further help on the other things addressed?", 'modified': '2022-12-06T18:19:01Z'}
review:
Aside from some inter-app syncing issues (which can usually be fixed without much effort) this is a solid app. Definitely made calorie tracking easy and help me to lose a bunch of weight. My main annoyances are that little consideration has been given to those of us outside the US. The nutritional information on our food is different, and aside from letting us dig through the settings to switch back and forth between cal and kj (why can‚Äôt we just toggle between these in the info entry fields?) there are some annoyances when it comes to manually adding new items. For example, if the exact amount of certain nutrients is listed on the packaging, but MFP only accepts % of DI, I have to calculate that before I can add it. Certain nutrients and vitamins there isn‚Äôt even an option to add. Etc etc. Also the search function is a bit funky, often it gives too results that are barely similar to what I type, when there are almost identical (or completely identical) results buried way down the list. There‚Äôs also no way to correct foods that have incorrect serving sizes. If someone‚Äôs added wrong info for that barcode, good luck, you‚Äôll have to make a custom meal and search for it every time. For no good reason other than they don‚Äôt care.

I also love how the my gradually remove basic features from the free tier over time instead of fixing the broken features which would compel one to pay for it in the first place.
title: Almost Very Good

review:
I‚Äôve used MyFitnessPal on and off for several years, both the free and premium version. The only features I used from premium was the ‚Äútime stamp‚Äù and ‚Äúno ads‚Äù.  I‚Äôve reverted back to the free version, because it has everything I need. 

The barcode scanner is great, and if the product isn‚Äôt there - you can add it. (Please include everything on the nutritional panel, guys) One thing that would help is if people would check their spelling when adding products to the lists, as these become available to us all and can make searching difficult. 

Absolutely love the recipe and meal features. You can add a favourite family recipe - and it will calculate how many calories per serving. I recommend keeping it to weight/per gram, so you can weigh your portion and get the true caloric value. 

In hindsight, it seems that the best way to get results it is to track your planned food BEFORE you eat. There are some sneaky calories out there!

I‚Äôve recommended the app to several people, I like the diary sharing option (with password) which can help with accountability and partnering on your health journey. 

It can be used in conjunction with many fitness trackers and exercise apps. 

All in all, it‚Äôs definitely a worthwhile app to use - both free and premium versions. Give it a go, you won‚Äôt regret it.
title: Great app - Definitely get this one!!!

review: Honestly apps like these where its to keep in track never work for me because that motivation lasted 3 days lol but get yourself a body scale and start a diet that YOU CAN HANDLE!!! And this app is nice. Im for real taking this diet seriously not bc of the app because I can genuinely see the results in the scale, don‚Äôt trust your eyes only you all. Unlike ur eyes, the scale tells you the truth and only the truth üòÇ so yes not the app but scale, but the app is a nice plus because my diet includes decreasing portion size so this is very nice, and it tells you how many carbs, protein and fat and even more with saturated fats and healthy fats. I‚Äôve learnt a lot and still learning. Thanks app, I‚Äôve been using it for about a week and lost 2kg, on the road to 3kg! (Dont worry I‚Äôm losing it healthy, eating all my vegetables and fruits just limiting carbs like bread, milk, obviously junk food too)
title: I love you fitnesspal

review: I‚Äôve used this app (the free version) for years now to track macros. It‚Äôs been a fantastic tool, has a huge variety of foods in its data base. Is easy to scan and add foods and supplements and I love you can see into your friends food diaries for inspiration meals, ideas and motivation. My only wish is that it would have the option to add or track NET CARBS along with total carbs. I know that this would help a much broader variety of healthy lifestyles who focus on net carbs in there diet. I for one am looking at changing my nutrition to focus on net carbs and unfortunately I think I will be forced to look for another app. Please consider including this in your next update!! MFP is really my preferred go to for tracking and if this was available I would more than likely go premium as it does everything else I want!
title: Fantastic app- though i would love one extra!

developerResponse: {'id': 36489618, 'body': 'Our apologies for any problems you are having with creating recipes, or tracking weight loss. review:
I trialled the premium service of this app and cancelled (through the app) before the billing date but for some reason cancelling through the app doesn‚Äôt actually work and you need to go to your Apple Store to cancel it‚Ä¶I can honestly say it‚Äôs not worth the $130 AUD that it costs and never intended in making the investment but here we are.  

Often when you try to add a new recipe and doesn‚Äôt add and you waste your time scanning all ingredients and amending food quantities just for it to not save.  It happens so often that I thought it was a premium service, hence me trialling premium, but it still happens. 

There is also no way to track your weight loss and keep the same macro split/calories - you have to go and do it again if you change your weight.  I get that when you loose weight you should be amending these things, but not when you loose small amounts of weight and track it weekly.
title: Not worth paying for the subscription!!

review:
I‚Äôve been using the premium version for a while now, and I think overall the app is very convenient and quick. I especially enjoy the extensive food database, since I rarely need to add my own nutritional info for food. I would however like to suggest a few improvements:
- currently you can add directions to meals but not recipes... which doesn‚Äôt make a lot of sense imo (unless I‚Äôm missing something here)
- for the dashboard, it would be good to have a few more display options, such as to not show calories or to show % remaining of nutrients 
- I wish net carbs was a thing, since it is easy to over consume fibre when on a calorie deficit, and end up having less calories from carbs and then getting less energy for workouts/day to day activities. It‚Äôs also easier to plan macros based on net carbs imo.
This will probably never be read but whatever lol
title: Good app but could use a few improvements

review:
Tracking keeps me honest and accountable. Gives me the leverage to walk away from unhelpful food and to make better choices. Quick entry and copy n paste features make tracking easy. At the end of each day, MFP predicts what my weight might be if every day is like today‚Äôs. That‚Äôs been a powerful motivator for me. Nutritional breakdowns of food are great for telling me what nutrients I need to eat more or less of. All helps my body feel satisfied. Also links with my exercise app, so exercise downloads automatically to MFP, and I can see the impact of that walk/run.
MFP has been a lifeline to me - given me power and control over my food that I‚Äôve been lacking for a long time. No longer feel powerless and defeated. I‚Äôm getting brilliant results!
title: Effective tool for weight loss/healthier eating

review: I have used via paid subscription for 2 years plus. I have noticed the app is now buggy and often times slow to respond to inputs. It wasn‚Äôt always this way. It consistently crashes on iPhone running the latest iOS. The tech advice is always uninstall and reinstall the app but this doesn‚Äôt change the behaviour. There are problems with the program that need to be addressed. Other than that it is good for recording meals, calories and tracking your weight. The community is okay but with eating and weight loss groups you will see a range of views from hard science to fad guru following to more esoteric and extreme examples. There are probably other apps that do the same thing and run better than this one. I turned off my paid subscription because the only paid feature I used was the barcode scanner and also because the app‚Äôs performance is not what it once was.
title: Very buggy

I am using your app, however I am also on a meal plan of 1200 cal per day with lite n easy and I‚Äôm noticing that the calories calculated in the app are not amounting to the correct calories that lite n easy has dedicated to the meals, I am wondering if there is a reason why this is?

If you offered students a discount to use this app as it is beneficial for students young people and anyone to be able to make healthy lifestyle changes. review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for quite some time now and I have been enjoying what it offers. I have just started dieting again and have paid for premium which allows me to concentrate on daily calories, and adjusting protein, carbs and fat for cutting down. Which means losing fat and keeping my lean muscle. This addition also allows me to set up 1 day a week to have a higher calorie as this is my cheat day. 
I would love it if zinc can be added to the nutrition page as I really would like to know if I‚Äôm getting enough of this in my diet.

title: Brilliant App

review:
MyFitnessPal has a huge catalogue of foods available to help keep you tracking and accountable, as well as allowing you to scan the barcodes of your food to help log all nutritional values, not just calories. 
I've used MyFitnessPal for years on and off, never being truly consistent, but I decided a week ago that I needed to lose this 15kg, and by being able to track exactly how many calories I'm consuming, I've been able to drop 2kg already. 
Only annoying thing is that it constantly insists that you upgrade to premium, not just in order to access other features such as macros and intermittent fasting scheduling, but also leaves a banner on every single tab in the app. If I want to go premium, I will - it's annoying that I have to look at that ribbon advertising premium everywhere.
title: Already lost 2kg

review:
I have used MyFitnessPal daily for 12 years. Not just for my own nutrition tracking, but also to track nutrition clients remotely. I‚Äôm a paid premium user, as are all my clients.

Tracking clients macros remotely is now excruciatingly clumsy using this app, and I can no longer use this platform for this purpose. Duplicate entries and bogus data is everywhere, and not just on one or two clients, right across the board. Mobile/browser data doesn‚Äôt sync properly, and the food database has grown into an abomination of false values. I‚Äôve attempted to resolve some of these issues with support but they don‚Äôt seem to care.

This nutrition tracking concept should not be difficult to deliver in simple to use app form. So after a very long time on MFP I‚Äôm now looking at alternatives. This is far from optimal.

developerResponse: {'id': 34995066, 'body': 'Thank you for providing this feedback. We will definitely share this with our team and we appreciate your help as we continue to improve our program!', 'modified': '2023-02-21T15:29:47Z'}
review: If you dont want to pay dont use this app and do t waste time going through sign up.   The payment terms and conditions are only presented after you have provided a lot of personal data and full consent for this data to be used and leocessed in the USA.   Having 'accepted' their privacy consents they then inform you of their pricing policy.   In Australia this is illegal under consumer law as it introduces new T&C's and is a form of drip pricing (and at $30 a month its a rip off- just think you could buy the entire Microsoft 365 suite 3x over for that).   Furthermore, a free 1 month trial is actually not free if it imposes the obligation (condition) to unsubscribe- this is a real cost, rea time and real effort.    This is a waste of time going through the sign up process to be informed of the pricing at the end.   Very disappointed with this cowboy and illegal approach to their marketing sign up process.
title: Not free.  Waste of time.  Illegal sign up process.

review: I love this app! I can do everything from just one application - track food, see exercise results, track my progress, and sync my fitness tracker. I‚Äôm also getting real value out of the blog: I‚Äôve gotten some great fitness tips, ideas for new exercises, and some new meal plans that are working well. I started using the app just to track food, and it made a big difference to see where my daily calories were actually coming from. I made some simple adjustments to what I was eating and had instant results. I‚Äôve slacked off from my routine a few times, and this app always helps me get back on track. Now I use it for everything :)
title: Everything I need for health & fitness

review:
This app is teaching me so much more about food and i‚Äôm really beginning to understand what im putting into my body. I started to use this app to support my partner to lose weight, but even i am learning too. And what i learn, i can share with him to help educate his experience, but also further understand his experience as he embarks in this same learning experience. 
I struggled to use the app at first, but i think that was more to do with my fear and overwhelm of grasping all of the nitty gritty about my food intake. With some steady confidence I have no idea what i wasn‚Äôt understanding! This app is so user friendly, great for beginners and pros alike. 
Im so glad there is something like this out there for people who are really trying to make a change for the healthier
title: So helpful

review:
In not normally one to leave reviews, but this app is fantastic. It might not suit everyone, but I just wanted a food diary and an exercise tracker in one - and this far exceeded my expectations.
It gets data from your Apple id about your daily steps, and it lets you build meals and recipes that you can just input to save time. But best off is the simple daily equation it provides, which is : (calories allowed per day - calories consumed) + calories worked off during exercise = calories left for the day.
Noom coach wants $80 a month to do the same thing so far as I can tell - this app does it for free. Strongly recommend!
title: Everything you need!

review:
I tried this app a few years ago but couldn‚Äôt get into it so I went back to weight watchers which I combined with Paleo for good results.
I recently tried this app again and learnt to set my metrics so that the % of fat, carbs and protein suited my chosen diet. 
Such a great app. I‚Äôve chosen to do the 1 month free premium trail and, after just 3 days, I‚Äôm likely to pay the $79 for the year of premium, it‚Äôs that good. I can plan all my meals and tweak them to suit my goals, record my weight and take pictures to log my progress along with my body measurements. I could go on, but safe to say, I‚Äôm a big fan. Try the free app and consider the month free trial of premium.
title: Brilliant - and amazing for free

review:
For over a week now I have been logged out of this app. In June I paid for a premium subscription and last week was unable to access my account. I contacted Support only to receive a bulk email which did not address my issue. I have sent over 5 emails to Support detailing my issue. As a result I received one email back which was the same bulk email I originally received.
I have had to start a new account, pay for a premium subscription again and as a result I have lost over two years of data from my old account. Emails to Support to merge my new and old account so I can access my data has fallen on deaf ears and I have had zero support. When you pay almost $140 in two subscriptions one would expect some decent support. In my case, there has been Zero support. Very unhappy and I would no longer recommend this app. My mistake for starting a new account.
title: Very Unhappy

review: I‚Äôve used the free version of this app for about 7 years and it has always been helpful, but this latest update is terrible. It is slow, my diary entries have gone missing, and you can‚Äôt log glasses of water correctly. Plus, all the premium subscription pop-ups are annoying! I get it, you want people to pay... payment for premium services are great, and I have considered it numerous times, but the free version does everything I need and I‚Äôve always been a huge advocate of MyFitnessPal. Please don‚Äôt make the current features useless with annoying pop-ups. With all the competition available today, I won‚Äôt need to remain a loyal user of yours. Your Product Owners really need to get back to customer-centred design instead of whatever sales strategy focus they‚Äôve currently got going on.
title: What have you done to your app?

review: This site enabled me over the last nine years or so to monitor everything I eat, which in turn, helped me initially, to lose 28kgs, and apart from a few twists and turns, helped to keep it off, similarly, four years ago I found I had type 2 diabetes, the weight loss, plus being able to monitor my carbs and sugar, have allowed me to manage my diabetes by diet, without the need for any meds, I have recommended this site to many people, but it‚Äôs a personal choice if they choose to use it, but it keeps me aware of what I‚Äôm eating, and hope it stays around as long as I do.
title: A cracker of a site

title: Destroyed by money grabbing tactics

developerResponse: {'id': 31465358, 'body': "Sorry to hear you're not enjoying the new update. After you have some time with the dashboard, we'd love to hear more detailed feedback to share with the team. Please reach out to us here https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new or directly at support@myfitnesspal.com.", 'modified': '2022-08-15T12:10:35Z'}
review:
With every update, this app gets worse. The new UI is frankly the most egregious example of terrible UX design I've seen in years. Functions which were previously a single button tap have been slowly hidden deeper and deeper into the annals of the app, and the latest unnecessary changes have worsened this again. Prior to being acquired by Under Armor, this app was an excellent tool for health and fitness. Ever since, it's become nothing but an advertising board in an attempt to make as much money through commercials and premium plans as UA can possible squeeze from its user base. Yet still, the worst part is that they will always get away with it, because there is no true competitor in the space.

Edit: Since writing this review, they've also added full-screen ads to the experience. Amazing!
title: Declining ever since acquisition by Under Armor

review:
It's a great app and easy to use. Love the barcode scanning option, how it remembers your foods and how you can set recipes and meals.
A few improvements: it'd be great to be able to write what the food was when entering calories using the quick entry option; also, it'd be good to be able to enter gram quantities rather than having to set quantity to 1 g then have 50 servings of it! I like to enter my meals ahead of time so I know I will have a balanced day within my calore count. It‚Äôd be good to be able to tick foods off as I eat them. Lastly, I am currently doing the Michael Mosely fast 800 diet. An intermittent fasting setting would be good as at the moment the app tells me off every night for not eating enough :(
title: Love it

developerResponse: {'id': 37496035, 'body': 'Thank you so much for letting us know! We are glad to hear this and will share your suggestion to connect with VeryFit with our team. We wish you all the success in reaching and maintaining all of your diet and fitness goals.', 'modified': '2023-07-05T22:27:02Z'}
review: Fantastic app! I‚Äôve recommended it to all of my fitness friends. It‚Äôs the only app I‚Äôve found that has great features even in the free version. I think its awesome for tracking calories and reminding me to stay on track. I really wanted to use the feature that connects to other fitness tracking apps, however, I use a Kogan smart watch and while this app connects to several apps, it does not connect to VeryFit. I thoroughly enjoyed the free trial and would definitely subscribe to the pro version if I could connect to VeryFit! Hoping this might be a feature in the future!
title: Fantastic app!

developerResponse: {'id': 33069475, 'body': 'Hi there! We are thrilled to hear you have been having success with the MyFitnessPal app. Thank you so much for sharing your feedback. We wish you a lifetime of health and happiness!', 'modified': '2022-11-09T15:00:27Z'}
review: Easy to use with a large library of foods to log. I especially like the function that allows you to set your macros to reach your goals. The app guides you with how many calories are ideal for the desired weight in the time frame. Each day as you "file" your diary, it gives an indication of what your weight would be like in 5 weeks which helps me stay on track, but also not to overthink the days where I go over. It is so rewarding to see yourself reach those goals and to be able to log and track them on the app!
title: Great app to help you with your goals

developerResponse: {'id': 42266112, 'body': 'We understand your frustration. But like most free apps, ads make it possible to keep our app up and running (and available for free). It‚Äôs how we pay our passionate employees, who work hard to research, plan, and build new features while supporting a community of over 200 million members. If needed, please email us at support@myfitnesspal.com.', 'modified': '2024-02-28T16:53:47Z'}
review:
There are lots of food/exercise tracking apps that offer a decent free version, with extra features and incentives to go paid. This app has so much advertising on the free version that it‚Äôs unusable. Probably half the screen is taken up with ads (some general advertising, and lots of big ads to ‚Äúgo premium‚Äù ) Even on large phone, it‚Äôs just too annoying to use, so I‚Äôve moved on to trial other apps. If you‚Äôre unconcerned with the high cost, it‚Äôs probably a good app. 
No cheap plans unfortunately.
**Oh and a word of warning- you will be asked to agree to collection of sensitive data ‚Äúcan change setting later‚Äù. But there‚Äôs no way to opt out of collection and use of your data, nor any way to ‚Äúchange settings later‚Äù.
title: Free version is no good

review: I‚Äôve been using this app on and off since around 2014 and has been the best thing to log my daily calorie intake and track my weight loss progress. I love that you can scan the barcode of your food and it picks it up straight away. I also love that I can pop in the link for a recipe and it automatically calculates things and I can see exactly how many calories and what nutrients I‚Äôm consuming. Super user friendly, very simple to use. Would recommend this to anyone wanting to track their calorie intake, weight loss or weight gain and nutrient intake.
title: LOVE this app

review:
It wasn‚Äôt the only tool, but without the help, the planning and resources available in this fantastic app, I‚Äôd still be a fatty!!!
I‚Äôve lost 65 kilograms, that‚Äôs 150 pounds or almost 11 stone! Huge in any language. I know about weight loss, all this trying for all this time, it‚Äôd be impossible not to pick up a little knowledge, but my number one must /have/do tip is get a plan and focus on the metrics,(measurements). My Fitness Pal gives me that and more. Get it, pay the money and get the full version and then get its companion, Map My Walk, you will see results. 
My Fitness Pal is everything an app should be!
Rob
title: Awesome training and weight loss partner

review: It seems to be impossible to find out the cost of the Premium Subscription before signing up for a free trial. This makes it impossible to make an informed consumer decision. I have quite a few app subscriptions, so am genuinely interested in the option of Premium, rather than free. I am going to check out if, not knowing the potential annual costs of subscription, confirms with our Australian Consumer Law - which app would need to conform with if selling to Australian residents through Apple‚Äôs App Store. There are quite a few frustrated people in the app‚Äôs Community wanting to know both the cost and benefits of Premium Subscription, so developer has sufficient feedback to know this is an issue for some users - an issue developer is obviously not taking seriously. Frankly, I find the lack of information on subscription rates bizarre
title: Cost of Premium Subscription

developerResponse: {'id': 30328264, 'body': "Sorry to hear you're not enjoying the new update. It‚Äôs a terrible change that despite preferring the food diary logging to other apps I‚Äôve used before I‚Äôm seriously considering deleting the app and finding a better health management app after using MyFitnessPal since 2017. Please fix this by making the weight logging/charts easily accessible on the main menu bar again.
title: New menu organisation ruined a good app, will probably be deleting it.

developerResponse: {'id': 38599710, 'body': "Thank you so much for your 5-star review! I love the fact that anything I eat has a measured kilojoule in this apps list. It makes it easier for me to manage my calorie intake. The bar scanning is very useful too. If you are too lazy to type the name u can always revert to it. I'm impressed that even most of the foreign food I type in has a list of how many calories it contains! This app is definitely my bible of health. üòèüëçüèº By the way I have lost 10 kilos already. üòÅ‚ù§Ô∏èüëçüèº

title: Super helpful in loosing weight (as long as u r honest to yourself)

review:
The application is useful as has big database. I have been using it for about 8 months.

My biggest gripe with with it is the amount of serious bugs. Currently when you save a meal entries get duplicated. Deleting the duplicates and resaving again, then adds 3 instances of the same items. Deleting the meal and reading with the same name does not re-add the meal, although the message says it‚Äôs added. This is a major feature that has been broken for quite some time. I have done 2 updates hoping it gets fixed. There are other usability glitches I encountered over time, but this one is particularly bad. So, quality needs work.
title: Quite useful - when works properly

review:
**FYI I paid for a year subscription** The app has a function of adding meals that you create by adding the ingredients and quantities. review: This app is excellent it can scan all your foods and tell you what‚Äôs in it carbs, sugar, protein etc you add everything you eat drink and what exercise you do and it will tell you how many calories you have left or have consumed- just pick what you want 1,000 1,200 or 1,600 per day - it also has junk food McDonalds KFC - you can add your own recipes too - if you sign up for extras it is not expensive and has some extra features- I was very surprised to see how much sugar was in so called healthy foods and it also links to your steps from your phone and adds it too - Fabulous
title: Excellent app

review:
I used to love this app but it now frequently crashes. So frustrating.
I cook from scratch a lot so adding my recipes is really laborious (the feature to add a URL and it should automatically load the recipe NEVER works for me) and I just can‚Äôt cope when it crashes half way through.
It might be good for people who eat a lot of food from packets as you can scan barcodes to get the calories added. But I‚Äôm looking for a new calorie tracker...
Ps 
Followed instructions to sync then uninstall and reinstall app. The recipe function still doesn‚Äôt work. I tried to add a dinner recipe and when I copied the ingredients the next page said the app had found a match for the ingredients (there were about 8). The ‚Äòmatch‚Äô was apples and cinnamon??? These items were not in the recipe, it just randomly added these ingredients.
title: Crashes frequently

developerResponse: {'id': 44351382, 'body': 'Thank you for providing this feedback on the cost of Premium. We will pass this along to the team to review. If we can help with anything else, or if you would like to provide additional feedback/suggestions, please email us directly at support@myfitnesspal.com. Thank you!', 'modified': '2024-06-03T22:16:58Z'}
review: I love MFP, it‚Äôs an awesome app for calorie tracking and step tracking, as well as the weight and progress photos part. I tried the premium feature, and you‚Äôre basically paying for convenience of having things on certain screens/windows and the plans. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth that much. It would be cool if you could pick and choose what you pay for. I‚Äôm not into the plans or advice, but I‚Äôm into the convenience of seeing things on the first page rather than having to look for it. A choice would be cooler and they‚Äôd probably get more customers too.
title: Love it, but it‚Äôs not worth the cost.

review:
I love just about everything in this app. It‚Äôs easy to track my food. 
The only 2 things I would like to see added and removed is: 
1: please add body measurements, these are just as important as weight. Sometimes we lose measurements instead of weight and would be awesome to track these as well. PS this feature is in most other apps!
2: Take the videos from the front page and move them to a tab so you can choose to look at them.
This app is my bible for helping with weight loss. Please consider the 2 changes especially the body measurements
title: My bible for weight loss

review: I initially loved this app for diet tracking. Easy input of foods. But lots of errors when it tries to calculate exercise. It regularly calculates my exercise calorie usage as -940 (yep, it tells me I should reduce calorie intake if I exercise), it sometimes double logs or doesn‚Äôt log at all my exercise, and it doesn‚Äôt allow manual logging or correcting of exercise for previous days (which is sometimes necessary because I sometimes don‚Äôt catch the errors until the following day). All these problems mean I can‚Äôt keep an accurate history. I‚Äôve logged problems with customer support but had to wait a week to receive an automated email that said ‚ÄúPlease reply if you still want help‚Äù (and I‚Äôm a premium subscriber).
title: Lots of bugs with exercise tracking and poor customer support

review: My FitnessPal has been amazing. I have been wanting to change my lifestyle for a while but it can be hard with a busy life. By entering my daily diet into the app I have learnt what to change. It has taught me sometimes even a salad can be too many calories if too many ingredients are used. I didn‚Äôt realise the sugar content can be high in a lot of foods that I thought were ‚Äòhealthy‚Äô. I love that the app tracks my steps every day too. I have lost 4kgs in a month and hope to lose more in the near future but I am also able to use the app to maintain my current weight.
title: Great app

review: This app is THE app to get if interested in tracking calories. However it falls in having a far too expensive premium membership system, for me and I assume most people who use this app the articles on the main page are pointless. It also suffers from crash issue and I often open the app to find it in ‚Äúoffline mode‚Äù despite having home wifi and data both available. It is a good app overall with a solid system for entering food data and a relatively large data base in comparison to other apps I have used. However the fact that you have to pay way to much for premium in order to simply see the macros of the food you enter kills the app for me and because of that I cannot recommend it.
title: Good and bad

review: This app used to be literally the best on the market - it was all I ever used and loved it!!! Since the last update, this app well and truly is a pain in the proverbial backside! Every single time I go to the app it asks me to consent to some stupid data collection policy - like every time I log a meal or a glass of water - yesterday I think I consented at least 20 times. I don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôve done My Fitness Pal but you need to fix this stuff up and FAST because it‚Äôs becoming very annoying and time consuming and after almost 5 years using this app I‚Äôm ready to delete it and say goodbye! To all those looking to start using this app - don‚Äôt bother until it‚Äôs fixed because it will drive you crazy with the constant requests for data sharing every time you click on the app!
title: Used to be the best now pathetic!

review:
Hey, I really love what you do here, this app has made it so much easier to count my calories and eat the most efficient foods. 
I don‚Äôt know if you guys read these or they are just made to the public, but if you do I think it would be beneficial to both you and the user to add Aldi products to your collection, as I‚Äô‚Äô from Melbourne and that is a very prevalent brand here where I get most my shopping from, it is just hard to count your exact calories when your entering slightly inaccurate nutrition information. 
Anyway, still love the app cheers.
title: Additional food options

The best app out there for nutrition tracking but I‚Äôve always found it quite hard to see things in the user interface.

To me, the UI is too zoomed in with a lot of unnecessary clutter. I rarely use it because of this. If it were more compact and gave you a better overview of the day‚Äôs metrics, the cost of premium would be justified for me. For reference, I use an iPhone 15 pro max for a larger screen

I hope that‚Äôs useful information for the team! Keep up the great work!
title: Amazing app, functionally, but the UX is lacking

developerResponse: {'id': 43076292, 'body': "We're very sorry that this type of ad is appearing within our program. Can you please send us an email at support@myfitnesspal.com so we can further investigate this ad for removal? Thanks!", 'modified': '2024-04-05T16:47:45Z'}
review: They want a ridiculous amount of money for a low value subscription, the ads pop up weird and delayed and ruin your browsing experience, the ads also auto play audio so if you‚Äôre listening to music the music will stop because of the ads even though you never touched them. Also when you open the app and go to touch a certain food section, it‚Äôll suddenly load up ads which bumps that section away or just reloads everything completely. The app runs like something made in 2010. Edit: developer responded, it‚Äôs not a specific ad. It‚Äôs seemingly every ad. You have video ads which steal focus if you accidentally tap it while scrolling. It‚Äôs an awful experience.
title: Overpriced bloatware and they are selling your data

review:
After using Cronometer, swapping to MFP has been a bit of a learning curve. Obviously, the database is much bigger but it MFP is a bit clunkier to navigate around compared to Cronometer. 
One thing that Cronometer has that MFP hasn‚Äôt, is the ability to put in a recipe under ‚Äúgrams‚Äù instead of serving size. Having grams allows you to measure out what you want after having cooked it. Looking at forums, there is a way around this, but it would be much simpler to have it built into the app in the first place. 
Definitely worth paying for premium to remove all the ads.
title: Somethings could be better

review:
This app is great and I‚Äôm sure it will help me get on top of my eating, but unfortunately it seems to be hardwired to deal with days without regards to the end user. If I could set what time a ‚Äúday‚Äù happens for me, it would go a long way to a better end-user experience!

I‚Äôm a nightshift worker, so I wake up at 3pm and go to bed at 7am. For me, ‚Äúbreakfast‚Äù lands about 4pm, ‚Äúlunch‚Äù is about 9pm, and ‚Äúdinner‚Äù is while I‚Äôm at work, usually 2:30am. However, by the time I get around to putting in my lunch into the system, it‚Äôs already decided the day has ended and I‚Äôm starting a new day.

I‚Äôd like to know how many kilojoules I‚Äôve eaten since last I slept, not since some arbitrary time of night.
title: Can‚Äôt handle nightshift life

developerResponse: {'id': 38499963, 'body': 'Thank you for your review of MyFitnessPal! We are grateful for your kind words, and pleased to know that the app has helped you along in your health and fitness journey. Keep up the excellent work!', 'modified': '2023-08-24T10:48:56Z'}
review: This is the best weight loss app on the market and I‚Äôve tried a couple of different ones and conventional diets. I‚Äôve tried this app a couple of times in the past too but gave up as it was too fiddly.  It has improved out of sight and I am enjoying using it, especially the barcoding and putting in recipes is easy. The calories/kj counter is fab and I‚Äôm also using a couple of their recipes but converting from ozs to grams, as I‚Äôm in Australia, can be a pain but that‚Äôs just one small thing.
title: Best weight loss app

developerResponse: {'id': 38897770, 'body': 'Our apologies for any problems you are having logging into your account from time to time. For additional support please send us an email to support@myfitnesspal.com. Thank you!', 'modified': '2023-09-13T16:14:34Z'}
review: The app will randomly log me out of my account, of which is already overpriced, and claims that my password, which has been used for the account for years, is incorrect. Courtesy to the web designers of the website, whenever one tries to reset the password in the event that it is ‚Äúincorrect‚Äù, the password itself is required to reset it. Why they cannot use an email verification system like other software companies to reset the password that it already claims is incorrect is beyond me. This has occurred half a dozen times in the past month. After a couple days the app will come to the realisation that my password is actually correct and will allow me to login again. Very underwhelming for the price.
title: Random logout = catabolic

developerResponse: {'id': 27113522, 'body': 'Hi there! Our apologies for any problems you are having. For additional support please visit: https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new or send an email to support@myfitnesspal.com. Thank you!', 'modified': '2021-12-29T03:41:25Z'}
review:
Great concept, tracks calories well... but!
Will not track steps through iPhone health app consistently, did so for some time, but no matter resetting and re-syncing it will not work which is really frustrating. 
The worst-
It keeps resetting start date weights and throwing out your progress, only fix is to bring your starting weight up to a later date to get accurate total weight loss, really poor in my opinion given the cost of the app, it really has way too many issues to be a streamlined experience, basically missing very key items working properly
title: Really needs improvements

review:
I absolutely love MFP. I use it every day in my journey in the gym, it‚Äôs so handy and easy to use; I love to see exactly how much protein, carbs, fats etc is going into my body

But I would love a feature where we can change it to a checklist if you will. I (along with lots of people) pre plan our days. Now if there was an option to ‚Äúmake checklist‚Äù where all the food we‚Äôve put in get‚Äôs a little circle next to it; and we can ‚Äúcheck it off‚Äù when we eat it; that would be awesome!! Obviously not demanding it; just a thought :-)
title: Love it! but here‚Äôs an idea...

review:
I have used this app on and off over the years when my interest peaks back to my health and this app makes it so easy to track calories and nutrition in your diet. It has a Huge database of foods in it and you can even add in your own. It is probably my most used and consistent app next to the obvious social media ones. 

I am not a personal trainer or anything like that so this app takes the stress and guess work out of my daily food intake.
title: A reliable and easy app to help track your eating

review:
I've been using this app for 18 months in conjunction with my Fitbit exercise tracker. The apps sync with each other so that I'm encouraged to exercise I order to increase the number of kilojoules I can eat. 
Fitness pal is very easy to use. You can scan barcodes, add your own recipes or meals, or just look up by name from the massive database. 
I find losing weight with this app relatively easy as long as you enter all your food BEFORE you put it in your mouth! 
I have several friends who now use this app and love it as much as I do!
title: Love this app!

developerResponse: {'id': 24694894, 'body': 'We are truly sorry for any issues you are having with the app. If you could please visit: https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/ or send an email to support@myfitnesspal.com for further help. If need be, you can always access the program via our main site at www.myfitnesspal.com.', 'modified': '2021-08-24T16:27:44Z'}
review:
I rely on the app because of its extensive database. I don‚Äôt need the other features. This is its value. I briefly considered paying for it, but I suspect that paying for it won‚Äôt resolve my problem.

This app hangs constantly. If I add a food to the diary, it hangs. Moving a food around, it hangs. It could be anything I do in the app. I don‚Äôt have the patience to see if it‚Äôs going to start responding again, so I force-quit the app and reopen it. This is extremely frustrating. Surely this is affecting everybody.

It does seem to always save what I just did, like adding a food, so there‚Äôs not a problem of data loss.
title: App Hangs Frequently

review:
Instead of thinking about food, what I can and can‚Äôt eat, I complete my daily info. All the information one can access is amazing. 
It is easy to navigate and it is fun exploring what it has to offer.  Once I did my first week weigh in, I went straight to this to record my loss.
Love it
And my friend and I encourage each other through the link.  I can see what she has been eating ha ha and just how active she has been. Sadly she has the same access to my data ü§™ü§™
title: On track thanks to this app

Thanks.', 'modified': '2023-11-01T18:25:55Z'}
review:
This app is great. It shows me how many calories are worth it each food that I‚Äôm eating and makes it easy to add and understand what I should be having for my body.
No, I do not fall this religiously as I do have a personal trainer, but it definitely helps me stay on track to stay under my goals.
This app also helps you with making it apparent and how much water are you having daily.
I found out that that was much a big help in my weight loss journey.

However, although this being such a great app halfway through my journey, I have found out that the app now crashes and does not open at all. I‚Äôm unable to access my previous entries or even open the app at all.
I am not sure what is going on if it is a server issue or if it is just the app itself. It is quite frustrating and definitely a hindrance. Fingers crossed it gets fixed quickly. If not, I will be taking my business elsewhere.
title: The App is good. I‚Äôm working fine now just crashes

review: Very easy to use and track what you‚Äôre eating, and the exercise completed. It can be personalised and updated or changed as desired.I love the reminder to log feature, it keeps me on track. It also tracks weight loss and your goal. This app is not only for weight loss but weight gain also. I have only marked 4* because of the payment feature required for more detailed information on what foods have fat protein or carbs in them . I am not a premium member as I can not afford to pay monthly for this but I assume it would make the app more user friendly and 5*.
title: My fitness pal

developerResponse: {'id': 30052178, 'body': 'Thank you for providing this feedback. We will definitely share this with our team and we appreciate your help as we continue to improve our program!', 'modified': '2022-05-30T13:14:52Z'}
review: I've been using this app for a number of years. It was a great app. It used to be simple, fast, with a straightforward UI. The latest release has further driven the app down a path of becoming cumbersome, bloatware that's lost a lot of it's easy-to-use convenience features E.g. The 'Quick Access' button has been removed, quantities are now entered by spinning 'picker' wheels rather than direct access. The performance has also got gradually slower, even on my iPhone 12, to the point where you have to wait to see if you've actually pressed a button. The last 'upgrade' also lost my synced data history. Disappointing.
title: Was a great app, now slow bloatware

review: I just downloaded this after seeing that it was recommended on a fitness/food website. While there are ads that encourage you to go premium, there is not any information that actually states what it will cost per month, even after scrolling through the terms and conditions (I mean honestly, who ever does this?!?) While it is easy to sign up for the Premium free trial and cancel this before payment begins, there really needs to be more upfront info so that consumers can make an informed decision straight away.
title: A great app but....

review: After downloading a range of apps and paying premiums I‚Äôve finally found the best in the game, this app has it all, calorie tracking, option to add your own recipes so that you can track your intake throughout the day and it also syncs your activity levels via Apple Watch etc. It really is a must have for a better lifestyle, you get all that without even paying a single cent! Can‚Äôt wait to upgrade to premium subscription to take full advantage. Well done team üí™üèæüî•
title: Best Health Tracking App On The Market!

developerResponse: {'id': 37733088, 'body': 'We do sincerely appreciate your feedback regarding the barcode scanner decision. Please know that we have passed along your review to our team for further consideration.', 'modified': '2023-07-17T22:54:22Z'}
review:
MFP used to be such a great app to use very simple and effective and the best part it was free to use. The new upgraded version of MFP is terrible it‚Äôs so confusing to use to many fancy things on the screen and also so disappointing you can‚Äôt use the scan tool anymore on the free version iv been using this app for 6 years and iv always been able to use this when needed but now clearly it‚Äôs all about a money grab and once updated you cannot use that function if you don‚Äôt pay a subscription. 
Very disappointing MFP you will lose a lot of people that have been using this long term from this move and updated version. 
Change it back to how it used to be.
title: Disappointing update not the same

review:
Leaving my old review down the bottom, as I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs still a valid point. 
But my new problem is with the cost of a premium subscription, 80$ per year, you must have a massive crack problem to expect people to pay that... surely you would help a lot more people with a lower price and also get a lot more subscribers. 80$Yearly is a joke 

I'm so sick of searching through 20 of the same thing looking for what is right. The foods that people input should be checked before it is turns up on everyone's list. Some of the calories are so far wrong it's pathetic... I have been using other calorie apps to double check the information on MFP. I don't care if I have to pay for it, if I find a better app, I won't be bothering with this anymore.
title: Nope

review: Just downloaded the app yesterday and so far so good, will take a little getting used to see how good it really is in the long term. However one thing is when entering my exercise I wanted to enter sprinter lunges and side to side jumps but they were only in the strength sub category and didn‚Äôt calculate calories so I tried the cardio sub category and both exercises weren‚Äôt there at all so I have no idea of the calories I burned. Would it not be valuable to just have all the exercises in both sub categories ? and also enter number of reps as well/instead of minutes ?
title: Exercise confusion

review:
This app is ok but needs work. I bought premium subscription hoping I‚Äôd have more control but I could only turn needs feed off but the app still starts up in the home screen and not last open page (diary entry). It forces you to use the blog / news feed even if you only want to use the diary. It‚Äôs a shame really, paid subscription isn‚Äôt cheap and last thing we want is delay in entering food items when we have our hands full.

The dates can get confusing as you must constantly remind yourself or try remember it's in USA format. My settings are all metric and Australia time but looks like date format is not changing for Australia.
title: Subscription still restricts proper access

developerResponse: {'id': 42566438, 'body': 'Thank you for your review of MyFitnessPal, we are thrilled to hear you are enjoying the free version of the program! Keep up the excellent work!', 'modified': '2024-03-13T15:14:34Z'}
review:
What I like the best about the app is that it encourages you with the consistency that you show in logging in daily.
It also gives you the opportunity to compare photos from the beginning of your journey to any point you‚Äôre up to.
The free app is tremendously helpful.
I have yet to experience the paid app. I don‚Äôt think I will, because I really only need to gauge my calories in order to gain weight.
This is by far, the best free health app I‚Äôve ever seen!!!üëåü§©üëçüèª
title: Motivation in real life

developerResponse: {'id': 31682504, 'body': 'Hey there, thanks for sharing your feedback‚Äîthough we‚Äôre sorry you‚Äôre disappointed. If you‚Äôre interested, here‚Äôs some more info about the Barcode Scan change **-** **https://rebrand.ly/barcode22**', 'modified': '2022-08-26T17:38:43Z'}
review:
MFP used to be good until they‚Äôve decided that removing their best feature of barcode scanning for premium users only. We have dealt with the annoying in your face advertisements and now they want you to pay for premium to be able to scan barcodes. 

The premium price is a ridiculous amount. No wonder why people are jumping over to Cronometer or Loseit. Very disappointing. Also this is a big rude finger to the individuals who helped set up the database over the years and those who have actively contributed. 

Remember the data breach years ago? Then now the advertisements that include scams, and last strike is moving the barcode scanning to premium.
title: They‚Äôre making barcode scanning a premium service

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for quite a while and it was great in the beginning. Would have rated 5/5. It has an extensive database of food and the barcode scanner is great. In the beginning it was very user friendly. However, now I can‚Äôt event enter a meal or scroll down the page without the app freezing or crashing all together. Flipping back through the days of the week causes the app to have a fit, it‚Äôs slow and it‚Äôs clunky. The freezing and number of crashes has frustrated me so much that I‚Äôve started looking for another app to track my food and exercise. It‚Äôs been like this for months and I‚Äôm a bit fed up.
title: Was great now it crashes/freezes all the time!

developerResponse: {'id': 32261874, 'body': 'Our apologies for any problems you are having. For additional support please visit: https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new or send an email to support@myfitnesspal.com.', 'modified': '2022-09-27T17:20:37Z'}
review:
I have used this app for several years, and have found it to be a terrific tool to steer my food choices. It helped me to lose a fair bit of weight, and generally merit off, while ensuring a balanced diet.
That was until recently! Now I can‚Äôt check the macros or nutritional information for my daily intake. Even the totals for the main food groups only show for each meal, with no total for the whole day. 
I miss the blogs and articles by dietary experts. The whole app has lost so much value to me. I really hope these features will be returned very soon.
title: Don‚Äôt like the latest update

developerResponse: {'id': 30215970, 'body': "Sorry to hear you're not enjoying the new update. After you have some time with the dashboard, we'd love to hear more detailed feedback to share with the team. Please reach out to us here https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new or directly at support@myfitnesspal.com.", 'modified': '2022-06-07T11:55:37Z'}
review:
This app used to be so easy and user friendly. The last update was the worst ever. It‚Äôs getting less and less user-friendly. The two most used features would be the diary and weight tracker. Why hide the weight tracker so deep that it takes 3 or 4 steps to find it (if you can remember where it‚Äôs hidden at all). Please, please put it back on the shortcuts bar. We don‚Äôt need a newsfeed shortcut. It used to open on the newsfeed so why change it? Terrible update!
Edit - change the ‚Äòplans‚Äô shortcut to a ‚Äòweight‚Äô shortcut and it will be more user friendly.
title: Terrible Update!

review:
Always when there an issue with the app they take awhile to fix and even to acknowledge it.
Since they are selling a service (premium features) on this app, they should at least provide some support.
A company responding on twitter asking to reach them by email(and then you need to wait for days) is not the best service you could expect.
Hopefully some day they will care for the customers and delivery a good customer service.
title: Good app / awful support

review: Paid one year upfront premium access. Got an email saying that due to security breach all customers were advised to reset their password. Did so and lost access to premium. Logged the issue with customer support and 5 days in nobody has been able to fix it. Been emailing back and forth and all I got back were standard pre written answers not even addressing what I had written in my email. On top of this in the FAQ section they point iTunes subscription buyers to Apple support and Apple clearly simply tells you they can‚Äôt do anything about it. Frustrating to say the least! Warning: Do not get yourself into a prepaid subscription with this app !!! Customer support is ridiculous!!!
title: Extremely disappointing customer service!

review: Macro tracking locked behind paywall which is a shame. The main issue with this app now are the ads. It‚Äôs ok I understand having ads on a free app but they affect the usability of the app. The banner add in diary always lags the app so you end up going into the wrong entry. title: Used to be a 5 star app

review: I really love this free app as it syncs to my Fitbit to keep track of steps for exercise and calories burnt. The scanner is a great way to quickly scan foods for a food diary. Can be time consuming to add foods made from scratch at home or specific exercises at the gym, but makes you more accountable and aware of l everything you do. The free part gives me everything I've needed. Have used this app for a few years and still has recipes and weight history stored. Totally worth giving it a go.
title: Excellent free app

review: On a whim I upgraded to premium, primarily because the base app nags you continuously to upgrade. By paying $80AUD I assumed that the user experience would be significantly improved, this is a lot of money for an app. Instead I was severely disappointed with the ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù you get from premium. The most frustrating part is the poor quality database of food items. Even basic common items aren‚Äôt available or don‚Äôt have logical portion sizes set up. Fat secret‚Äôs database is much more logical and complete. I am sorry to have wasted my money, and I‚Äôm disappointed that I could not get a refund when I realised what little I got for my money. My advice is to just use the free app or better still use the fatsecret calorie counter.
title: Very poor value

developerResponse: {'id': 46274344, 'body': "Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience with us. We're thrilled to hear that you're finding success with our app! If you ever have any questions or feedback, feel free to reach out at support@myfitnesspal.com - we're here to help!", 'modified': '2024-08-26T17:56:22Z'}
review:
My husband and I are working together to lower our weight. I grew up with a mother was always on a diet, which worked but only for a short time. 

What I realised is my issue is about my snacks!! I eat too much of them. It‚Äôs not necessarily that they are bad it‚Äôs just that I eat too much in one sitting. So I want to be held accountable for what I eat. This has surprised me and explains why I am gaining weight. My husbands issue is portion size.

We have not paid for the app and there are son annoying bits but it does the job.
title: Accountability for what I eat

review: My partner and friend both have MyFitnessPal and are able to use the scan barcode feature. Neither of them have paid for the premium app but are able to use the feature however my app says that this is a premium feature and I have to pay to be able to use it. I‚Äôm unable to afford the premium price so it is quite frustrating searching for every food, scanning would be much easier and I‚Äôm unsure why I can‚Äôt use it when it doesn‚Äôt appear to be a premium feature for other people.
title: Premium features

review: As someone who has struggled with their weight, I find this app extremely useful. I set my goal for my weight and then daily monitor the numbers to ensure I don‚Äôt over eat. This is so helpful in particular when your extremely busy. It has helped me to become conscious of the food I eat in between meals and also the foods to stay away. I have a Garmin watch which tracks my activity. The integration between the Garmin and this app is cool. I know at the end of the day whether I‚Äôm in the positive or negative based on how much exercise and how much food I‚Äôve eaten.
title: Great help

title: Never counted calories in my life!

review:
You do know that most of the world uses the Metric system right? Well this app forgets that. Even though you might change it to metric and for the most part it does display information in this format. When adding food it does not, you still have to manually convert it over yourself. Really a poor oversight from a developer viewpoint. 

Obvious that it was developed for an American market.
title: Some problems getting correct measurements in metric system

review: This is a great app, the developers have put a lot of thought into how it functions. It cleverly calculates your daily calorie intake along with exercise management to reach a goal. The fatal flaw with this app is that you can‚Äôt specify custom serving sizes like many other apps of this type. The developers have suggested a clunky work around to the problem, but isn‚Äôt efficient. I would probably pay the subscription fee to use this app if allowed me to specify the weight of my food. Especially because there are other great partner apps associated with this one. Such a shame.
title: Great app with one fatal flaw.

review:
Usually when picking from a list of food, there are over 10 and you have to pick the one best suited to you. I love this app but I honk it could be that little bit better if there were small descriptions saying what the food was. 
For e.g: this morning I was listing the eggs Benedict that I had. There are many different options but I wasn‚Äôt sure if the one I picked included 1 or 2 eggs, bacon or ham, 1 or 2 pieces of bread nor if it came with hollandaise sauce :) I think this would be a huge improvement 
Thankyou
title: Small description on meal choice

review:
I have been using the basic version of this app for a long time even giving it a go with free premium subscription a try and found that basic was good enough for me. 
Getting rid of barcode scanning shows how greedy the company is getting.  Also it gets frustrating when multiple options shows up for one food item leading to confusion about which one is accurate. 

I don't have time for greedy company who has lost innovation and thinks taking off basic feature and start charging it.
title: Sad to see company is getting greedy

review: Was a great app- still is to some extent and I‚Äôve been using it for over 7 years but the cost of the premium upgrade for what‚Äôs offered is actually laughable, there are plenty of other food tracking apps that offer the ability to more closely track your macros without paying $15 a month... I‚Äôm thinking it‚Äôs time I actually start seriously looking at what the others have to offer- and no I have no interest in paying $80 upfront every year either, as a one off I would have considered it or if there was considerably more content offered maybe but $80 a year or $15 a month is beyond greedy- will stop recommending this as a good tracking app
title: Premium rip off

review:
MyFitnessPal is a great free food tracking app and a great food database (avoiding manual input). Only downside is that it‚Äôs quite buggy at times.

Feature request: it‚Äôs annoying that I can‚Äôt add food to a meal and have my search results come from any meal history (and not just the meal I‚Äôm in). For example if I eat bacon and eggs for dinner and I try to add bacon to meal 3, my search won‚Äôt show the bacon that I eat every weekend as part of meal 1. It‚Äôs super annoying that my meals and choices are inconsistent.
title: Great free app and resource - quite buggy (at times)

review:
Really good food database and options to track but this app has gotten worse over the years.

Starting up and 'loading' takes 2-3 seconds, you don't expect that for an app you're opening 5-6 times a day. Fix your startup performance. 

Every time you open and then switch out and back, it resets and reloads. If you're researching a meal, you might have to do it 3-4 times and start from scratch. If you're adding some food and just have to check something outside the app, you gotta start again. And every time you sair 2-3 to 'restart'. It's an app, it should save state.

The amount of clicks to add a food if you need to customise it is way too many (5 I think), there's gotta be a better customer experience.

Users of this app are usually on the go, trying to jot down their food before they forget and these things really make it hard to do so, no point all that functionality is performance and UX is not up to speed.
title: Has gone backwards

developerResponse: {'id': 27747773, 'body': 'Hi there! We are so happy to hear that the MyFitnessPal app has helped you along with your goals! Keep up the excellent work! :)', 'modified': '2022-01-30T17:46:58Z'}

This app works, cost effective and extremely helpful to get you into a routine!

developerResponse: {'id': 31682555, 'body': 'We‚Äôre glad to know how you feel (even if we‚Äôre sorry you feel that way). Moving Barcode Scan to Premium was a tough decision. Read more about it here if you‚Äôd like **-** **https://rebrand.ly/barcode22**', 'modified': '2022-08-26T17:41:24Z'}
review:
I have used MyFitnessPal daily since 2011, but today is the day I finally uninstall the app. This app was all about helping people achieve their goals by assisting in calorie tracking, but over the years greed took over and the developers kept finding new ways to make money off users. 

One by one all the features went premium, yet I still hung onto the app. But after today‚Äôs announcement that barcode scanning is now going to be a premium feature, I am out. 

I fully anticipate this app to go on a downward spiral soon enough. Ridiculous pricing model and greed will be its downfall. Much better free alternative apps elsewhere.
title: Pure greed

title: Almost 5 *‚Äôs!!!

review:
WARNING : DO NOT UPDATE

Hey guys just a heads up turn off Auto Updates for this App. Do not update it - will still work the same! They have designed it now to remove free features from this app with every update probably because MFP is trying to make more money from Premium subscriptions. Some features removed with the latest update:
-Extremely invasive banner and pop-up ads
-No opting out if Recipes, Workouts and Plans. I think MFP is moving more toward a lifestyle app more than a calorie counter. Which you are forced into with the latest update.
-Meal sizes appear as only fractions in grams no more decimals when changing serving size
-No more weekly view of macros
-Search function is slower and less options. You have to keep re-entering your search word of the food and click search rather than auto searching with word input.
-You have to select the tick when adding food. No more auto-adding when logging food. You have to confirm each time.

WARNING : DO NOT UPDATE.
title: WARNING DO NOT UPDATE

review:
A friend told me about MyFitnessPal and initially I was skeptic about it. 
I‚Äôve decided to have a go and use it anyway, to manage my caloric intake. I‚Äôve upgraded to premium as a free trial for the first month to get better features and see how it works. 
Today, two months since I‚Äôve stated using this app, I‚Äôve lost 9kg. It has been an easier journey, knowing my calories limits and how much I should be eating each meal. 
It has helped me to meet my weight loss goal, and I will continue using it until I have a good idea of how much I should be eating just to maintain the ideal weight. It‚Äôs thumbs up from me.
Highly recommend this app. 
I‚Äôm a 43 years old , active male.
title: Great app I‚Äôve lost 9kgs so far.

Charging for use of the barcode scanner is a ridiculous and unfair move to subject loyal users to. I‚Äôve been using MFP since 2013, but I instantly deleted it when I heard about the change. EDIT: And please don‚Äôt insult me by linking that ‚Äúexplanation‚Äù webpage that basically says ‚Äúwe‚Äôre taking away a core feature and charginf users to access a database they built in the first place - if you don‚Äôt like it, we don‚Äôt care.‚Äù Cheers.
title: Changes to free vs. premium make this app not worth using.

developerResponse: {'id': 31724938, 'body': 'We‚Äôre glad to know how you feel (even if we‚Äôre sorry you feel that way). Moving Barcode Scan to Premium was a tough decision. Read more about it here if you‚Äôd like **-** **https://rebrand.ly/barcode22**', 'modified': '2022-08-29T16:07:08Z'}
review: if I could give 0 stars i would, ive been using mfp for YEARS and theyve decided to take the barcode scan feature (which lets you scan barcodes for that foods nutritional info) and make it a paid, subscription only feature. this feature was the only reason i would ever recommended this app and now i will continue to recommend 'lose it' which has this feature and wont be charging for it. dont let this greedy business take more money from you for features theyve had promised for all users, for years, for free.

review:
With a growing user base and regular promotion via social media MyFitnessPal continues to charge greater and greater amounts for the use of targeted macro counting - arguably the whole point of the program.

If there were an adequate alternative I‚Äôd suggest that be your first point of call, rather than unsustainable price rises.
title: Previously affordable application exponentially gouging

review: I have been using the free version for over 3 years with no major issues. Ontop of this, I have been signed out by the app twice with no explanation and when I try to login it says my password is wrong. I then haven‚Äôt been able to recover my details via email. Have now jumped to different platform, it was a good run while it lasted.

review: When it works this app is great but recent for no reason my account disappeared and i lost all my data so now have to start again. support told me i deleted my account although i absolutely did not. in the past i‚Äôve had problems with password reset. the account profile management and sign up steps are the worst user experience on an app i‚Äôve ever had.. super confusing and disappointing when your account and tracking data mysteriously disappears.

review:
Super helpful tool, I ordinarily recommend it to everyone, but the past few weeks I‚Äôve been getting buggy pop up ads that fill the whole screen and can‚Äôt be closed! Only way to get rid of them is shutting down the app and restarting it.

I get that ads provide income from the free version, I‚Äôm cool with that, but pop ups (already the most obnoxious of all ads) just become intolerable when they‚Äôre full screen and won‚Äôt close.
title: Usually amazing but buggy ads since update!

review: MyFitnessPal has been a game changer in my quest to making me a better me. Even when I forget to log every single calorie, MyFitnessPal serves as a reminder that I need to keep at it. The calorie tracking coupled with my personal fitness device makes all the difference. Now when I consider eating something I ask myself, Do I really want to have to log that and admit that I actually ate it.

review: The only app that I‚Äôve used that consistently has helped me lose weight and keep track of my fitness. My biggest recommend to date.
title: Results will show

review:
I‚Äôve used this for the past three years and when it comes to weight cutting just before the season it has served me well.

While putting work into the gym, focusing on my lifts and training, throughout each day I‚Äôm logging my meals, ensuring I‚Äôm reaching and abiding by my calories and macros.

Nutrition is very very important, and MyFitnessPal absolutely assists with keeping track of EVERYTHING you are eating.
title: UA FitnessPal - The BEST for calorie counting.

review:
MyFitnessPal  was shown to me by a good friend. He has used this app to lose 8 kilos over 8 weeks. He was in danger of having a stroke  and my fitness pal was recommended by his Doctors and it‚Äôs working for him. 
I joined the challenge to encourage him to keep using  myfitnesspal.    I have used this simple to use app over the first month  I have come from 83+ kilos down to now 81.5 kilos. 
I‚Äôve been around  85 to 86 kilos for 30 years. I reduced to 83+ after a careful diet but that was as far as I could go. 
I recommend myfitnesspal to anyone who is serious about  using a healthy wag to consistently lose some weight or to maintain your current weight. 
Well done  ‚Äú myfitnesspal ‚Äú

I have no vested interest in making this glowing blog. 
Ray.
title: Mr.

review: I am a paid customer and have been using my fitness pal for about 2 years now. Since yesterday I am unable to edit recipes or add new ones. I tried everything from deleting recipes, rebooting my phone and now deleting and reinstalling the app. Now I am unable to log into the app AT ALL. I am a body builder and required this app to work. I have reported this to my fitness pal but have yet to hear from them. The app on a day to day basis works well until yesterday.
title: Major glitch

review:
Although I use the app daily I get so frustrated at constant hangs, screen don‚Äôt scroll and simply stopping working forcing me to close the app and restart. This happens when connected to WiFi and roaming. For a mega premium app I expect better much much better.

I‚Äôm signed up for a year so will continue to use under protest...

Using IPhone 8.......
title: Great concept poor performance

review:
I have type 1 diabetes and I‚Äôm looking for a new app for carb counting to work out my insulin dose. The problem with this app is that each meal only shows an overall calorie count, not a carb count. If I want to know the total carbs, I have to click on each item then add the figures up in my head. 

Also, you can‚Äôt enter times that you ate things in the free version of the app, which seems ridiculous. When my blood glucose goes too high or low, I like to be able to go back and check what I ate and when.
title: Not helpful for carb counting

review:
Love this app and have been using for years. The layout has been consistently clean and easy to use, has a huge database of foods and excellent apps to accompany it. Encourages people to exercise self control. 

The new update, whilst making the skin of the app look more appealing, generates a lag and difficulty in inputting foods, switching from tab to tab etc. Once the lag has been fixed this app is for sure a 5/5.
title: Bad update

review:
My fitness pal suffered a data breach in 2018, and passwords and logins, as well as IP addresses (including my own) were put up for sale on the dark web in 2019. I was NOT informed of this from my fitness pal, rather I found out after searching have I been pwned when the email and password I use with fitness pal was used to try to log in to my apple account. 

Under Armour couldn‚Äôt protect my data. They also didn‚Äôt let me know when the had the breach so I could take steps to protect myself. They have no business being an app. Perhaps they should stick to making tights.
title: Data breached.

review: Is there a reason why this app is crashing all the time.... I'm talking several times a day when I use the app. Incredibly frustrating particularly when I am loading a recipe. I have use my fitness pal on and off over the years and it has always be great! But this crashing all the time is driving me crazy. My phone has the latest iOS. So, why is it crashing?
title: Crashing all the time

review:
The only app I know of that will accomodate and sync with a whole variety of fitness trackers for free! The app has its faults from time to time but they‚Äôre always fixed in a timely manner and the help desk staff are so professional. I‚Äôve lost 10kg out of my 15kg goal so far, and am still losing weight and inches with the help of this app. 

Thank you MyFitnessPal and keep up the great work!
title: Fantastic free app!

review: Overall very useful and app and I would recommend but one thing that drives me mad is when trying to create a recipe there is no way to add foods you have created directly into you recipe. So you have to search through hundreds of wildly inaccurate foods to try find the one you created. Please fix this!
title: Great over all but a few very annoying aspects

developerResponse: {'id': 28069604, 'body': 'Thank you for providing this feedback. We will definitely share this with our team and we appreciate your help as we continue to improve our program!', 'modified': '2022-02-15T19:36:55Z'}
review:
While the app is a good concept, and I‚Äôd love to be able to keep track of my calories, the app doesn‚Äôt allow people under the age of 18 to use it. This is ridiculous, why does being underage mean I can‚Äôt use an app to list what I eat on any particular day? Please lower the age to about 13 or 14 if you can.

Edit: I understand that maybe people who use this app incorrectly may develop eating disorders, but I‚Äôm not sure if blocking teens from using it will fix that. Perhaps just have more resources discussing the dangers of being underweight etc.
title: Good concept

review:
MyFitnessPal is a useful app for diet tracking and weight-loss. I use the free version of the app and don‚Äôt feel that I miss out on any important functionality.

It‚Äôs flaw is that the app sends notifications reminding me to log meals which I have already entered into the app, which can be quite frustrating as it happens three times daily.

Overall: a great app.
title: Helpful app with frustrating notification bugs

review:
Apple Watch full independent functionality when used alone without the phone. If Nike can have voice prompts so can Runtastic on watch alone.
Also, recently stalls when starting the app on the watch requiring opening the phone app separately. Bit of a pain if you forget after several kilometres reading zero distance and recording snails pace. A bug. Needs a fix.
title: Great so far but needs...

review:
By downloading the app, you automatically agree to theryre yearly subscription so it seems! I downloded the app simply to have quick look, just to check it out (because i had heard good things)... Was Not made aware anywhere that they automatically start to charge you! I dont use the app at all, and wasnt ready to start using it because i think Its a little expensive just to plan your meals and calories.... 

So... Ive tried to get in touch with My Fitness pal and they refer you to apple.. So now I waiting on a reply from apple.

Basically i think who ever is running this my fitness pal are very sneaky. 

Just be careful, if your like me and you download a few similar apps to see which you like the best, even if the app is limited, and then you go on to purchase... not with this app, they‚Äôll charge you from the start even if you had no clue....
title: They take your money, even if you dont sign up!!

review: I am throughly enjoying my 16/8 fasting Entering the food into the diary is very easy It is great to be able to plan my meals and snacks . Thank you for making this Ap so good to use. My trial month was excellent. Now the next 12mths will work well. My weight is coming off easily.

Was told by my doctor to use this to help with controlling calorie intake for a diabetic diet. Gave up as every time I went to log a meal all I had to choose from was American choices! 

I downloaded and paid for this in the Australian App Store, set it up stating I was in Australia so you would think the developers would have had some way to make it Australian for this market but no everything is American.

I do not wish to spend hours trying to find something close to what I am making for each meal so I can log it, that‚Äôs not the idea or point of these things.

NEWSFLASH - WE DO NOT ALL LIVE IN AMERICA 

If you sell an app in the AUSTRALIAN App Store then do your due diligence and make it semi Australian.

Guess I will have to find something more local, and let my Doctor know to stop recommending this app! Way to go idiots.

I emailed MFP saying I felt duped into this and did not want the premium service and was got generic and useless response. Not happy, feel very deceived and short $80 and the premium service is not worth a cent of it.
