I‚Äôve successfully used calorie counter apps on-off over the past few years. 

After trialling MyFitnessPal for a few days just to see what others apps were available, I found:
- l that liked the option of entering a new recipe by using the recipe‚Äôs online URL 
- I liked that the app can sync with the health app to track your steps without manual entry
- I didn‚Äôt like not being able to input foods on a per gram basis. It makes it difficult to accurately track when the measurements are inconsistent between foods. 

As I would normally use this app on a daily basis, I felt that the inconvenience out weighed the positives. I‚Äôll be reverting back to my tried and true, Easy Diet Diary.

review:
The app is incredibly frustrating to use.
It no longer syncs with apple health or withings health mate reliably. 
It will delete exercise data offsets randomly.
It deletes recipes that were saved.
The meal log notifications are all over the place, It sends me reminder notifications at 2am for breakfast, 4am to log dinner for that day.
It doesn‚Äôt have as many meals/food products as other apps (I‚Äôm in Australia)

The Premium features are completely worthless with such a huge bug in this App, I am now totally regretting my decision to have paid for the premium subscription.

review: In February 2018, the diet and exercise service MyFitnessPal suffered a data breach. The incident exposed 144 million unique email addresses alongside usernames, IP addresses and passwords stored as SHA-1 and bcrypt hashes (the former for earlier accounts, the latter for newer accounts). In 2019, the data appeared listed for sale on a dark web marketplace (along with several other large breaches) and subsequently began circulating more broadly.
title: Data breach occured

review:
2 January 2017: Started using the MyFitnessPal iOS app. 
24 January 2017: Seems great so far. Food database is very useful.
June 2017: Travelled for 3 weeks but continued to use MyFitnessPal to count calories/kilojoules. 
30 September 2017: Achieved my target weight of 73kgs/161lbs. Lost 26kgs/57lbs using MyFitnessPal since January 2. 

I highly recommend the MyFitnessPal app.

review: It‚Äôs only down falls are very restricted amount of nutritional vitamin minerals. Also important of omega 3 fatty acids. Also the sugar which was getting me over stressed with my ptsd. As it has like 12mg. Well my natural muesli with light milk and nutritional powder. No added sugar but has real cranberry and whole nuts. That puts me into the red. So fruit juice and a banana or anything gives you a large red circle. I was suffering huge low energy and other things. My Dr notes i had stopped any sugar in coffee and no softdrinks but was also avoiding natural yogurt and fruit. So my natural sugars where so low it was causing problems and blood test showed such low iron these are now being addressed. Which he did blame the program. Due to my ptsd and going from terrible diet to good foods but seeing the big red circle and over the daily recommendation. Concerned him that this with others especially younger people in sports would choose the program. With out seeing natural fruit sugars and milk sugars where being added to sugar in general. So this should be adapted to a level to include all sugars including natural yet given a number that was a nutritional level. So yes added sugars are best to avoid but food sugars are in most things. So even two tea spoons of added sugar is not overdoing it. Honey better. But there is nothing regarding this. Which could lead to health problems. Plus I can‚Äôt address any old foods that have been upgraded. As noted in other ones you can take a photo of the front and weight plus nutritional info per serve and within 24hrs your food has been upgraded to often lower fats and calories. I would give more the info sheets are good. When have time to read them. Vitamins minerals and omega‚Äôs from fish as I‚Äôve started having more be great. Also a mg of the vitamins not a percentage.
title: It‚Äôs good app.

developerResponse: {'id': 34437823, 'body': 'We are truly sorry for any issues you are having with the app. If you could please visit: https://myfitnesspal.zendesk.com/hc/ or send an email to support@myfitnesspal.com for further help. If need be, you can always access the program via our main site at www.myfitnesspal.com.', 'modified': '2023-01-23T13:41:18Z'}
review:
To appease those at risk of EDs and those worry about them‚Ä¶ maybe age to strive the ap, maybe make weight loss info only available to people who are actually overweight But With 40% of USA obese!!!(clinically obese!!) It‚Äôs clearly not the teens with EDs we need to be concerned about! My issue with the ap, is it‚Äôs not encouraging me to loose ENOUGH weight!!! As a female government advice of 2000 cal/8400kj per day is WAY too much (and probably too less for most men)‚Ä¶ It‚Äôd be great to be able to set the upper limit of kj/cal is the best estimate for MY body .., before I‚Äôll start putting on weight. Atm if I log 8000kj the ap says I‚Äôll loose weight.. I just won‚Äôt. I‚Äôll be lucky to maintain at that high amount, more likely I‚Äôll put on weight‚Ä¶  thus far from this ap ‚Äútelling me to loose weight fast‚Äù as some other delusional people have said- I could say exactly the opposite. Truth is‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs just not enough data for the ap to make an accurate prediction. All cal/kj are not even processed by the body equally! Stop asking me to update. Ap auto updated on one of my phones- now I avoid using the ap on that phone‚Ä¶it‚Äôs awful to use, too many extra steps adding food and daily weight‚Ä¶.

New update is also super slow, takes 5seconds for a tap to register‚Ä¶ which leads to multiple taps, leading to wrong button pressesü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è.

 I just started to get a pop up telling me to update- no thanks!! The things I use most often seem to be moved to harder to reach places, and I don‚Äôt like that when you enter an item in the diary, it doesn‚Äôt take you back to that diary day summary, but stays on the search item you just entered- and you have to manually delete that item before searching for the next singular food item eaten that meal- TEDIOUS. . I had a dream there was a way to access all the food data I have entered in 2014‚Ä¶ that has been deleted with out my permission‚Ä¶ just an email saying it *would* happen‚Ä¶ if I was asked BEFORE deletion I would have said just let me keep the last 6 months of 2014‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs all I ever want to go back and look at On that note- it would be good to have an easier way to go back to dates I lost weight (like ‚Ä¶ from the graph - make it clickable
title: Hate the new update- they have caved to the ED crowd
